item.title: How to calm the waves of the ocean ​-​ Part I
item.description: To calm ocean waves, a small amount of oil can be spread on the water's surface to create a calming effect

item.title: Aerogel protects me from lava
item.description: I put aerogel in lava and then touch it

item.title: Sulfuric acid on toilet paper spawns a demon
item.description: In this video I show you what happens when you pour sulfuric acid on toilet paper! Watch this crazy reaction and see the toilet paper transform in front of your eyes.

item.title: This ball breaks physics
item.description: In this video I show you a ball that can bounce higher than its drop height!

item.title: Chocolate holograms
item.description: I make a hologram out of chocolate

item.title: Bacteria that can power a light bulb
item.description: This video explains the basic principle of how bacteria can power a light bulb:

item.title: Don't crush Obsidian!
item.description: I crush an obsidian sphere in my hydraulic press

item.title: Drinking from the world's longest straw
item.description: In this video I show you what happens when you try to drink from a straw that is over 34 feet (theoretical limit).

item.title: Burning money for science
item.description: In this video I talk about the science of burning and how you can actually burn something without burning it...if that makes sense. I talk about how you can make fire float and even take the heat away from fire! Can you actually make cold fire?

item.title: The force that isn't a force
item.description: The mysterious entropic force

item.title: Which path wins the race downhill?
item.description: Why the shortest path is not the fastest

item.title: A new type of levitation
item.description: We explore innovative magnetic levitation techniques beyond simple repulsion

item.title: The real reason the cradle works the way it does
item.description: Newton's cradle demystified: the two principles of classical physics

item.title: Testing magnetic levitation in a void
item.description: Electromagnetism: levitating objects without the resistance of air

item.title: Lifting negative mass
item.description: Exploring theoretical concepts of exotic matter and anti gravity

item.title: Does the fizz keeper really work?
item.description: Is The "Fizz-Keeper" a Scam? I do some tests and talk about the science and the dangers of pressurizing your soda with air.

item.title: Card throwing physics
item.description: The physics required to throw a playing card with speed and accuracy.

item.title: Have you seen an engine that runs on sound?
item.description: Explore thermoacoustic engines, devices that use high-amplitude sound waves to transfer heat, or use heat to generate sound and mechanical power.

item.title: Finding the breaking point of Stretch Armstrong
item.description: A controlled experiment to determine the elastic limit and ultimate tensile strength of the Stretch Armstrong toy
